messages.text:
Hello alex.brainman@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/odbc

Hi Alex,

I'd like to cut down the mail volume of golang-dev. Would you mind moving
odbc reviews to a separate mailing list?

Thanks,
Andrew

That's some solid proof real work is being done guys!
I love your comment Andrew, and good work Alex, keep it up (:

On 2013-05-13, at 1:53 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Hi Alex,
> 
> I'd like to cut down the mail volume of golang-dev. Would you mind moving odbc reviews to a separate mailing list?
> 
> Thanks,
> Andrew
> 
> -- 
>  
> --- 
> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "golang-dev" group.
> To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
> For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out.
>  
>

I'm just throwing this idea,
but why don't we have golang-dev for development/coordination/design decisions,
and golang-review for code review?

It seems to me like both should be two different process.
If you need both, just subscribe to both, right?

Yes, we're changing the process.  Expect announcements soon.



On Mon, May 13, 2013 at 11:34 AM, Alex Belanger <alexb@frankandoak.com>wrote:

> I'm just throwing this idea,
> but why don't we have *golang-dev* for development/coordination/design
> decisions,
> and *golang-review* for code review?
>
> It seems to me like both should be two different process.
> If you need both, just subscribe to both, right?
>
> --
>
> ---
> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups
> "golang-dev" group.
> To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an
> email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
> For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out.
>
>
>

On Tue, May 14, 2013 at 2:34 AM, Alex Belanger <alexb@frankandoak.com>wrote:

> I'm just throwing this idea,
> but why don't we have *golang-dev* for development/coordination/design
> decisions,
>
the contribution guideline says that design proposal and its discussion
should be made on
golang-nuts, and code review is placed on golang-dev.

> and *golang-review* for code review?
>
> It seems to me like both should be two different process.
> If you need both, just subscribe to both, right?
>
i think most of subscriber of golang-dev will indeed need both, so there is
little benefit
splitting golang-dev into two.

On Mon, May 13, 2013 at 10:41 PM, <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:

> LGTM
>
> Sorry for the noise.
>

No worries.

It was just the final straw on the camel's back.

The camel was due to collapse imminently anyway.

I though golang-nuts was mostly for help? That's where we redirect everyone
when its not development related.

Because something to consider is the fact in the near future, we will want
a  list to get help with the language (not everyone has IRC), another list
less noisy for development decisions and serious stuff when (that helps
identifying flamewars) and a last one for code review, which is only
increasing in volume.

You call them how you want, but to start with these three would be a good
begining.

golang-nuts
golang-dev
golang-review

Cheers.

LGTM

Sorry for the noise.

Alex

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/odbc/source/detail?r=93ba376e9242 ***

odbc: remove golang-dev from defaultcc

R=alex.brainman, alexb, bradfitz, minux.ma, i.caught.air
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9391043

Committer: Alex Brainman <alex.brainman@gmail.com>

subject: code review 9391043: odbc: remove golang-dev from defaultcc
